title: Twentieth Army (Japan)
text:
The was an <a href="corps">army</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a> during the <a href="Second%20Sino-Japanese%20War">Second Sino-Japanese War</a>.
History.
The Japanese 20th Army was formed on September 10, 1941 under the <a href="Kwantung%20Army">Kwantung Army</a> in <a href="Heilongjiang">Heilongjiang</a> province in northern <a href="Manchukuo">Manchukuo</a> as a <a href="garrison">garrison</a> and <a href="border%20guard">border patrol</a> force. It came under the administrative control of the <a href="Japanese%20First%20Area%20Army">Japanese First Area Army</a> on July 4, 1942. On October 19, 1944, it was transferred to <a href="central%20China">central China</a> and came under the command of the <a href="Japanese%20Sixth%20Area%20Army">Japanese Sixth Area Army</a> to provide a garrison force for areas left under defended by the movement of troops further south in <a href="Operation%20Ichi-Go">Operation Ichi-Go</a>. From April 9, 1945 - June 7, 1945 it carried out the offensive in the <a href="Battle%20of%20West%20Hunan">Battle of West Hunan</a>, the last major Japanese offensive of the <a href="Second%20Sino-Japanese%20War">Second Sino-Japanese War</a>, during which time it suffered significant casualties. After the <a href="surrender%20of%20Japan">surrender of Japan</a>, the 20th Army came under control of the <a href="Kuomintang">Kuomintang</a> government of the <a href="Republic%20of%20China">Republic of China</a> and was assigned to the maintenance of public order until it was officially disbanded on July 15, 1946 at <a href="Hengyang">Hengyang</a>, <a href="Hunan">Hunan</a> province.
Historical controversy.
Some of western works has a difficulty distinguishing "Twentieth Army" from <a href="Eleventh%20Army%20%28Japan%29">Eleventh Army (Japan)</a> belonging to the same <a href="Japanese%20Sixth%20Area%20Army">Japanese Sixth Area Army</a> group.
